content: The following lists events that happened during **1976 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Benjamin Henry Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Henry_Sheares) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### April - 1 April – The [Singapore Corporation of Rehabilitative Enterprises](/wiki/Singapore_Corporation_of_Rehabilitative_Enterprises) (SCORE) is formed to help ex-offenders find employment. ### June - June - The [Pearl Bank Apartments](/wiki/Pearl_Bank_Apartments) is completed, making it Singapore's tallest and densest residential building in Singapore at that time. The Apartments will soon be demolished after being sold to [CapitaLand](/wiki/CapitaLand) in an en-bloc sale in 2018, which will be redeveloped into One Pearl Bank by 2023. ### October - 1 October - - The [OCBC Centre](/wiki/OCBC_Centre) is officially opened. - The [Business Times](/wiki/Business_Times_(Singapore)) is launched. ### December - 23 December – The PAP wins all 69 seats in the [1976 General Election](/wiki/1976_Singapore_general_election). ### Date unknown - The [Queensway Shopping Centre](/wiki/Queensway_Shopping_Centre) is opened as a sports mall. The mall also hosts Singapore's first public escalators. - [St James Power Station](/wiki/St_James_Power_Station) was decommissioned and its operations is taken over by Pasir Panjang and Jurong power stations. ## Births - 20 January — [Jamus Lim](/wiki/Jamus_Lim), [Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore)) MP for [Sengkang GRC](/wiki/Sengkang_Group_Representation_Constituency). - 21 January — [Christopher de Souza](/wiki/Christopher_de_Souza), current [Deputy Speaker of the Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Deputy_Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore) and [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) MP for [Holland-Bukit Timah GRC](/wiki/Holland%E2%80%93Bukit_Timah_Group_Representation_Constituency). - 20 April — [Henry Kwek](/wiki/Henry_Kwek), [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) MP for [Kebun Baru SMC](/wiki/Kebun_Baru_Single_Member_Constituency). - 2 June — [Yaw Shin Leong](/wiki/Yaw_Shin_Leong), former [Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore)) MP for [Hougang SMC](/wiki/Hougang_Single_Member_Constituency) (d. 2023). - 27 June — [Intan Azura Mokhtar](/wiki/Intan_Azura_Mokhtar), former [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) MP for [Ang Mo Kio GRC](/wiki/Ang_Mo_Kio_GRC). - 14 July — [Yeo Wan Ling](/wiki/Yeo_Wan_Ling), [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) MP for [Punggol GRC](/wiki/Punggol_Group_Representation_Constituency). - 15 July — [Desmond Lee](/wiki/Desmond_Lee_(Singaporean_politician)), current [Minister for Education](/wiki/Minister_for_Education_(Singapore)). - 2 August — [Pritam Singh](/wiki/Pritam_Singh_(Singaporean_politician)), 9th [Leader of the Opposition](/wiki/Leader_of_the_Opposition_(Singapore)) and 9th [Secretary-General of the Workers' Party](/wiki/Secretary-General_of_the_Workers%27_Party_of_Singapore). - 2 December — [Loretta Chen](/wiki/Loretta_Chen), theatre director and media personality. ## Deaths - 25 January — Koo Young, former [Barisan Sosialis](/wiki/Barisan_Sosialis) legislative assemblyman for [Thomson Constituency](/wiki/Thomson_Constituency) (b. 1936). - 10 April — Sellappa Ramasamy, former [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) Member of Parliament for [Bukit Merah Constituency](/wiki/Bukit_Merah_Single_Member_Constituency) and [Potong Pasir Constituency](/wiki/Potong_Pasir_Constituency) (b. 1927). - 4 October — Chua Boon Lay, footballer (b. 1902). - 28 October — [Chen Jen Hao](/wiki/Chen_Jen_Hao), educator and pioneering artist (b. 1908). - 15 December — [P. S. Raman](/wiki/P._S._Raman_(diplomat)), diplomat (b. 1920). This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1976 in Singapore
